extendedInfo.description: The absolute best diet diary on the Android Market. Take charge of your own health by tracking the foods you eat every day along with your health symptoms. This app records date and time of each meal, breakfast, lunch, dinner, snack, and drink, and most importantly, your symptoms. Take the information to your doctor, to monitor your diet and check which foods to which you are sensitive or allergic. Then, email the report to your health professional. Tutorial:From the Home screen, tap one of the chosen events you wish to enter information such as Breakfast, and the entry screen for Breakfast appears. From there, enter the foods you had for breakfast by tapping in the blank window which opens the keyboard. You may also turn your device horizontal entering your information. Once you have entered the foods for breakfast, click set to change date and/or time when you ate breakfast. Then, click save. When clicking save, this takes you immediately to the Diet Diary screen. Repeat the above for Lunch, Dinner, Snack, Drink, and Symptom. You may enter multiple entries for each category with different times for each.To copy and paste the same entries is easy as well. Press and hold in an entry screen containing the information you wish to copy, this brings up a dialog box asking how much you want to copy. In this example, select "Select All." Then, select "Copy." Then select a new entry from the Home screen you wish to paste the information copied. Press and hold in the entry box of the category selected, which brings up a dialog box that says "Paste." Tap "Paste" and you have now copied the previous entry into a new one.From the Diet Diary Screen, you can swipe horizontally to change days and view previously entered information. Or, tap the gold date bar to change the date to a specific day you want to view. You may also scroll entered information by swiping vertically up to see later information or down to see earlier information. Deleting an entry is easy by touch and hold action over the entry you wish to delete.Now, send the report to your health professional. You can now email the report directly from the Diet Diary screen. Tap Menu, then Preferences to enter email address you want your Docâs Diet Diary delivered. Then, tap Menu, tap Send Report, then choose csv or pdf. Then tap Send.  Then select the account you want the report sent from. Then tap the letter icon at the top to the send the report. You can optionally enter a message for the email. Simple!Take charge of your health with Doc's Diet Diary!To Report a Crash;Send email to support@docsdietdiary.com with the exact steps you were taking before and up to when the app crashed. Thank you.Known Issues with HTC phones;Suggest installing and changing to another free keyboard from the Android Market, which will correct the problem. The native keyboard causes the cursor to stick after entering more than one line of text.

reviews.title: Not impressed
reviews.comment: It looks cute, but really I could do the same thing in fewer steps by just keeping a running list of food and symptoms in notepad. It\'s also impossible to edit and entry after it is saved. I had accidentally put pm instead of am on an entry and when I tried to edit it got a second entry.
reviews.author: Nicole Herron

reviews.title: Terrible Interface
reviews.comment: The interface makes everything harder than it needs to be.  I\'m not sure this app is doing anything more than keeping a list.
reviews.author: James Hands

reviews.title: Simple and Good
reviews.comment: Just what I was looking for. It would be nice if there were different color themes though
reviews.author: Michelle Elaine

reviews.title: Problems after last upgrade
reviews.comment: I\'ve been using this app for a couple months and liked it until the recent Android upgrade.  There is a bug with setting the time - it won\'t accept the time I input and puts in a random time instead.  Very frustrating. I would have given it a lower rating except it has worked fine until recently.
reviews.author: Mandy Pethick

reviews.title: MSI Enjoy 7
reviews.comment: Okay so the minute customization has improved, but everytime I input my minutes, it keeps on inputting 1:45 pm, and no matter how I fix this, it keeps reverting to 1:45 pm! SUCKS! And can you make it possible for us to save/backup our data without having to send it to an email address?
reviews.author: Mary Ann Lopez

reviews.title: Really to use. Very helpful.
reviews.comment: Very helpful in trying to figure out stomach problems.  I like that it creates nice report.
reviews.author: David Dunn

reviews.title: User friendly
reviews.comment: Using to keep track of my diet while on the elimination diet. Email to my dietician. Super easy to use
reviews.author: Laura S

reviews.title: Just what im looking
reviews.comment: This app is perfect! Love pdf report aswel so I can track my intack without all that calorie counting crap. Just a suggestion could we hav selection of color scheme, backgroud, font or customisable like we can put a photo for bakground.stil great app for my needs
reviews.author: Mo Makarika

reviews.title: Brilliant App!!!
reviews.comment: Ive had this app for some time now and i love it!!! It enables me to keep an accurate food diary which i can easily email to my personal trainer for my diet planning, tips and advice. Definately a great app!
reviews.author: Gemma Summerfield

reviews.title: Good diary,  needs calories
reviews.comment: Great diary but wish it had a simple spot to type a number and total up the calories for each meal. Not a calorie database like all the other apps,  just a simple addition calculation since I can add the food labels myself,  I\'d like a diary app to write what it was and total my cals. Period.  Back to pen and paper.
reviews.author: Audrey Caldwell

reviews.title: One of my best apps
reviews.comment: Thank you so much for this application!
reviews.author: kathy go

reviews.title: Good but....
reviews.comment: Like look of the interface and it is simple and intuitive to use. But a serious drawback is the input. The keypad obscures the lower half of the screen on my S2 and a copy and paste function would save me a lot of repetitive typing.
reviews.author: Tom Lister

reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment: I like the simple interface. Very user friendly. No rocket science. I wish it had more features like a calorie counter, suggested meal plans and a more organized slot for servings, dishes food types etc.
reviews.author: Neon Mannequin

reviews.title: Very good app on nexus 7
reviews.comment: Trying to track diet against symptoms to help identify health issue - fantastic for free app, simple interface, select day to check or edit entries. Some extra features I\'d like - as part of symptoms I\'d like fields for blood pressure and pulse to allow easy graphing over time. Fields for activity level and how I\'m feeling and reporting to allow analysis of this data. Happy to pay for these features, not interested in calories, food suggestions etc as weight watching is not my problem, these would annoying.
reviews.author: David Ambrose

reviews.title: Basically ok
reviews.comment: It\'s better than a notepad. Things it should have but doesn\'t: auto suggest food entries, correct locale date format, common sense meal times, entry reminders.
reviews.author: Martin Evans

reviews.comment: This is an excellent app that let you email your diet history in a PDF format
reviews.author: matt bushman

reviews.title: Easy, takes voice commands, allows you adjust times.
reviews.comment: Can be emailed to yourself or doctor. Wish it had a reminder that came up one hour after the meal if I didn\'t feel it in on time.
reviews.author: Dominick Curto

reviews.title: Ok for free app
reviews.comment: If you need a free app, this one is great. If you can spend a few dollars,  you can get an app with more features.
reviews.author: Cheryl Elder
